article.headline: Louisiana Tech 93, Boise State 60
article.story: RUSTON, La. (AP) -- Paul Millsap and Wayne Powell each scored 20 points as Louisiana Tech won its third straight game with a 93-60 victory over Boise State on Thursday night. It was the biggest victory margin ever for Tech in a Western Athletic Conference game. Daevon Haskins scored 19 points and Donell Allick 18 for the Bulldogs (9-8, 4-4). Franco Harris scored a game-high 23 points, hitting five 3-pointers, for Boise State (9-10, 3-5), which lost for the first time in three games. The Bulldogs went out to a quick 12-0 lead and led 35-18 at halftime. Tech's lead expanded to 71-41 with 6:31 left to play following a tip-in by Millsap. Powell had 15 rebounds to help Tech to a 52-38 advantage in that department and Tech outshot Boise State 48 percent to 38 percent. The 93 points was the most scored by Tech since the 2002-2003 season. <

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
